class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, the major driver in the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" class="html-attribute-value">Industrial Revolution</span>"&gt;</span>Industrial Revolution<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, underscores the importance of engineering in modern history. This <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beam_engine" class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> is on display in the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technical_University_of_Madrid" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Technical_University_of_Madrid</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Technical University of Madrid</span>"&gt;</span>Technical University of Madrid<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.<span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="71"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;b&gt;</span>Engineering<span class="html-tag">&lt;/b&gt;</span> is the use of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_method" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Scientific_method</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Scientific method</span>"&gt;</span>scientific principles<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> to design and build machines, structures, and other items, including bridges, tunnels, roads, vehicles, and buildings.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-1</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-1" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-1</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The discipline of engineering encompasses a broad range of more specialized <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_engineering_branches" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/List_of_engineering_branches</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">List of engineering branches</span>"&gt;</span>fields of engineering<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, each with a more specific emphasis on particular areas of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Applied_mathematics" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Applied_mathematics</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Applied mathematics</span>"&gt;</span>applied mathematics<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Applied_science" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Applied_science</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Applied science</span>"&gt;</span>applied science<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, and types of application. See <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_engineering" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Glossary_of_engineering</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Glossary of engineering</span>"&gt;</span>glossary of engineering<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="72"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The term <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>engineering<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span> is derived from the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Latin</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span "cleverness" and  <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>ingeniare<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span>, meaning "to contrive, devise".<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span value="128"></td><td class="line-content"><br></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="129"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;h2&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;span <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-headline</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Definition</span>"&gt;</span>Definition<span class="html-tag">&lt;/span&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/h2&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="130"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Engineers%27_Council_for_Professional_Development" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/American_Engineers%27_Council_for_Professional_Development</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">American Engineers&amp;#39; Council for Professional Development</span>"&gt;</span>American Engineers' Council for Professional Development<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> (ECPD, the predecessor of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accreditation_Board_for_Engineering_and_Technology" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Accreditation_Board_for_Engineering_and_Technology</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology</span>"&gt;</span>ABET<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>)<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-ABET_History_3-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-ABET_History-3" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-ABET_History-3</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;3&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> has defined "engineering" as:</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="131"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="132"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;blockquote&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The creative application of scientific principles to design or develop structures, machines, apparatus, or manufacturing processes, or works utilizing them singly or in combination; or to construct or operate the same with full cognizance of their design; or to forecast their behavior under specific operating conditions; all as respects an intended function, economics of operation and safety to life and property.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-ECPD_Canons_4-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-ECPD_Canons-4" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-ECPD_Canons-4</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;4&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-ECPD_Definition_on_Britannica_5-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/blockquote&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="133"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;h2&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;span <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>  <span class="html-tag">&lt;div <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">thumbcaption</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;div <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">magnify</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Grondplan_citadel_Lille.JPG" rel="noreferrer class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Enlarge</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span>Relief map of the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citadel_of_Lille" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Citadel_of_Lille</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Citadel of Lille</span>"&gt;</span>Citadel of Lille<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, designed in 1668 by <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vauban" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Vauban</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Vauban</span>"&gt;</span>Vauban<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, the foremost military engineer of his age.<span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="136"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>Engineering has existed since ancient times, when humans devised inventions such as the wedge, lever, wheel and pulley, etc.</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="137"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The term <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>engineering<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span>  is derived from the word <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>engineer<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span>, which itself dates back to the 14th century when an <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>engine'er<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span> (literally, one who builds or operates a <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_engine" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Siege_engine</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Siege engine</span>"&gt;</span>siege engine<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span>) referred to "a constructor of military engines."<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-6</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-6" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-6</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;6&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> In this context, now obsolete, an "engine" referred to a military machine, <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>i.e.<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span>, a mechanical contraption used in war (for example, a <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catapult" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Catapult</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Catapult</span>"&gt;</span>catapult<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>). Notable examples of the obsolete usage which have survived to the present day are military engineering corps, <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>e.g.<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span>, the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army_Corps_of_Engineers" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/United_States_Army_Corps_of_Engineers</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">United States Army Corps of Engineers</span>"&gt;</span>U.S. Army Corps of Engineers<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="138"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The word "engine" itself is of even older origin, ultimately deriving from the Latin <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>ingenium<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span> (c. 1250), meaning "innate quality, especially mental power, hence a clever invention."<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-7</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-7" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-7</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;7&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="139"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>Later, as the design of civilian structures, such as bridges and buildings, matured as a technical discipline, the term <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_engineering" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Civil_engineering</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Civil engineering</span>"&gt;</span>civil engineering<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-ECPD_Definition_on_Britannica_5-1</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-ECPD_Definition_on_Britannica-5" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-ECPD_Definition_on_Britannica-5</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;5&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> entered the lexicon as a way to distinguish between those specializing in the construction of such non-military projects and those involved in the discipline of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_engineering" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Military_engineering</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Military engineering</span>"&gt;</span>military engineering<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="140"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="141"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;h3&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;span <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-headline</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ancient_era</span>"&gt;</span>Ancient era<span class="html-tag">&lt;/span&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/h3&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="142"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;div <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">thumb tright</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>  <span class="html-tag">&lt;div <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">thumbcaption</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;div <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">magnify</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span noopener">/wiki/File:Pont_du_Gard_BLS.jpg</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">internal</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Enlarge</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span>The Ancient Romans built <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aqueduct_(watercourse)" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Aqueduct_(watercourse)</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Aqueduct (watercourse)</span>"&gt;</span>aqueducts<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> to bring a steady supply of clean and fresh water to cities and towns in the empire.<span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="143"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egyptian_pyramids" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Egyptian_pyramids</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Egyptian pyramids</span>"&gt;</span>pyramids<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> in <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Egypt" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Ancient_Egypt</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ancient Egypt</span>"&gt;</span>ancient Egypt<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ziggurats" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Ziggurats</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ziggurats</span>"&gt;</span>ziggurats<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesopotamia" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Mesopotamia</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Mesopotamia</span>"&gt;</span>Mesopotamia<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acropolis_of_Athens" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Acropolis_of_Athens</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Acropolis of Athens</span>"&gt;</span>Acropolis<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parthenon" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Parthenon</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Parthenon</span>"&gt;</span>Parthenon<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> in Greece, the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_aqueduct" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Roman_aqueduct</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Roman aqueduct</span>"&gt;</span>Roman aqueducts<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Via_Appia" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Via_Appia</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Via Appia</span>"&gt;</span>Via Appia<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and Colosseum, <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teotihuac%C3%A1n" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Teotihuac%C3%A1n</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Teotihuacán</span>"&gt;</span>Teotihuacán<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, and the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brihadeeswarar_Temple" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Brihadeeswarar_Temple</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Brihadeeswarar Temple</span>"&gt;</span>Brihadeeswarar Temple<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanjavur" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Thanjavur</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Thanjavur</span>"&gt;</span>Thanjavur<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, among many others, stand as a testament to the ingenuity and skill of ancient civil and military engineers. Other monuments, no longer standing, such as the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanging_Gardens_of_Babylon" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Hanging_Gardens_of_Babylon</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Hanging Gardens of Babylon</span>"&gt;</span>Hanging Gardens of Babylon<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pharos_of_Alexandria" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Pharos_of_Alexandria</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Pharos of Alexandria</span>"&gt;</span>Pharos of Alexandria<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, were important engineering achievements of their time and were considered among the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seven_Wonders_of_the_Ancient_World" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Seven_Wonders_of_the_Ancient_World</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Seven Wonders of the Ancient World</span>"&gt;</span>Seven Wonders of the Ancient World<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="144"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The six classic <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_machines" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Simple_machines</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Simple machines</span>"&gt;</span>simple machines<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> were known in the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Near_East" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Ancient_Near_East</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ancient Near East</span>"&gt;</span>ancient Near East<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>. The <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wedge_(mechanical_device)" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Wedge_(mechanical_device)</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Wedge (mechanical device)</span>"&gt;</span>wedge<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inclined_plane" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Inclined_plane</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Inclined plane</span>"&gt;</span>inclined plane<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> (ramp) were known since <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prehistoric" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Prehistoric</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Prehistoric</span>"&gt;</span>prehistoric<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> times.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-8" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-8</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;8&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wheel" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Wheel</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Wheel</span>"&gt;</span>wheel<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, along with the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wheel_and_axle" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Wheel_and_axle</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Wheel and axle</span>"&gt;</span>wheel and axle<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> mechanism, was invented in <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesopotamia" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Mesopotamia</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Mesopotamia</span>"&gt;</span>Mesopotamia<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> (modern Iraq) during the 5th millennium BC.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-9</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-9" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-9</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;9&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lever" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Lever</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Lever</span>"&gt;</span>lever<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> mechanism first appeared around 5,000 years ago in the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Near_East" rel="noreferrer it was used in a simple <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balance_scale" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Balance_scale</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Balance scale</span>"&gt;</span>balance scale<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>,<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Paipetis_10-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-Paipetis-10" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-Paipetis-10</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;10&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> and to move large objects in <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Egyptian_technology" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Ancient_Egyptian_technology</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ancient Egyptian technology</span>"&gt;</span>ancient Egyptian technology<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-11</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-11" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-11</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;11&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The lever was also used in the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadoof" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Shadoof</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Shadoof</span>"&gt;</span>shadoof<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> water-lifting device, the first <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crane_(machine)" rel="noreferrer machine, which appeared in Mesopotamia circa 3000 BC,<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Paipetis_10-1</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a noopener">#cite_note-Paipetis-10</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;10&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> and then in <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Egyptian_technology" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Ancient_Egyptian_technology</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ancient Egyptian technology</span>"&gt;</span>ancient Egyptian technology<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> circa 2000 BC.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-12</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-12" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-12</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;12&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The earliest evidence of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pulley" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Pulley</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Pulley</span>"&gt;</span>pulleys<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> date back to Mesopotamia in the early 2nd millennium BC,<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Eisenbrauns_13-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Egypt" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Ancient_Egypt</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ancient Egypt</span>"&gt;</span>ancient Egypt<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> during the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" class="html-attribute-value">Twelfth Dynasty of Egypt</span>"&gt;</span>Twelfth Dynasty<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> (1991-1802 BC).<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-14</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-14" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-14</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;14&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" class="html-attribute-value">Screw (simple machine)</span>"&gt;</span>screw<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, the last of the simple machines to be invented,<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Woods_15-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-Woods-15" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-Woods-15</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;15&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> first appeared in Mesopotamia during the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neo-Assyrian" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Neo-Assyrian</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Neo-Assyrian</span>"&gt;</span>Neo-Assyrian<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> period (911-609) BC.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Eisenbrauns_13-1</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-Eisenbrauns-13" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-Eisenbrauns-13</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;13&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egyptian_pyramids" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Egyptian_pyramids</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Egyptian pyramids</span>"&gt;</span>Egyptian pyramids<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> were built using three of the six simple machines, the inclined plane, the wedge, and the lever, to create structures like the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Pyramid_of_Giza" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Great_Pyramid_of_Giza</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Great Pyramid of Giza</span>"&gt;</span>Great Pyramid of Giza<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-16</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-16" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-16</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;16&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="145"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The earliest civil engineer known by name is <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imhotep" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Imhotep</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Imhotep</span>"&gt;</span>Imhotep<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-ECPD_Definition_on_Britannica_5-2</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-ECPD_Definition_on_Britannica-5" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-ECPD_Definition_on_Britannica-5</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;5&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> As one of the officials of the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pharaoh" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Pharaoh</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Pharaoh</span>"&gt;</span>Pharaoh<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Djoser" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Djoser</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Djoser</span>"&gt;</span>Djosèr<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, he probably designed and supervised the construction of the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyramid_of_Djoser" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Pyramid_of_Djoser</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Pyramid of Djoser</span>"&gt;</span>Pyramid of Djoser<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> (the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Step_Pyramid" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Step_Pyramid</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Step Pyramid</span>"&gt;</span>Step Pyramid<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>) at <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saqqara" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Saqqara</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Saqqara</span>"&gt;</span>Saqqara<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> in Egypt around 2630–2611 BC.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Barry_17-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-Barry-17" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-Barry-17</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;17&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> The earliest practical <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water-power" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Water-power</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Water-power</span>"&gt;</span>water-powered<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> machines, the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_wheel" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Water_wheel</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Water wheel</span>"&gt;</span>water wheel<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value class="html-attribute-value">Watermill</span>"&gt;</span>watermill<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, first appeared in the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persian_Empire" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Persian_Empire</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Persian Empire</span>"&gt;</span>Persian Empire<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, in what are now Iraq and Iran, by the early 4th century BC.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-18</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="146"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span><span rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Kingdom_of_Kush</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Kingdom of Kush</span>"&gt;</span>Kush<span power instead of human energy.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-19</span>" <span to store and contain water as well as boost irrigation.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Hinkel_20-0</span>" <span examples of Greek mechanical engineering. Some of Archimedes' inventions as well as the Antikythera mechanism required sophisticated knowledge of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a gearing<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> or <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epicyclic_gearing" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Epicyclic_gearing</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gear_train" rel="noreferrer the Industrial Revolution, and are still widely used today in diverse fields such as <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="148"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>Ancient Chinese, Greek, Roman and <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" was developed by the Greeks around the 4th century BC,<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-30</span>" <span <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Ballista</span>"&gt;</span>ballista<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a In the Middle Ages, the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The earliest <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Program (machine)</span>"&gt;</span>programmable machines<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> were developed in the Muslim world. A <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Music_sequencer" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Music_sequencer</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Music sequencer</span>"&gt;</span>music sequencer<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, a programmable <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Musical_instrument" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Musical_instrument</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Musical instrument</span>"&gt;</span>musical instrument<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, was the earliest type of programmable machine. The first music sequencer was an automated <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flute" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Flute</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Flute</span>"&gt;</span>flute<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> player invented by the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Banu Musa</span>"&gt;</span>Banu Musa<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> brothers, described in their <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Book_of_Ingenious_Devices" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Book_of_Ingenious_Devices</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Book of Ingenious Devices</span>"&gt;</span>Book of Ingenious Devices<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span>, in the 9th century.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Koetsier_44-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-Koetsier-44" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-Koetsier-44</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;44&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-45</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> In 1206, Al-Jazari invented programmable <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>/<span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" class="html-attribute-value">Robot</span>"&gt;</span>robots<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>. He described four <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>Before the development of modern engineering, mathematics was used by artisans and craftsmen, such as <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Millwright" rel="noreferrer Aside from these professions, universities were not believed to have had much practical significance to technology.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span 32</span>"&gt;</span>&amp;#58;&amp;#8202;32&amp;#8202;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/span&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="157"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>A standard reference for the state of mechanical arts during the Renaissance is given in the mining engineering treatise <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" geology, mining, and chemistry.  <span class="html-tag">&lt;i&gt;</span>De re metallica<span class="html-tag">&lt;/i&gt;</span> was the standard chemistry reference for the next 180 years.<span class="html-attribute-name">data-file-width</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">3648</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">data-file-height</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">thumbcaption</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;div <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">internal</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Enlarge</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span>The application of the steam engine allowed coke to be substituted for charcoal in iron making, lowering the cost of iron, which provided engineers with a new material for building bridges.  This bridge was made of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cast_iron" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Cast_iron</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Cast iron</span>"&gt;</span>cast iron<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, which was soon displaced by less brittle <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wrought_iron" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Wrought_iron</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Wrought iron</span>"&gt;</span>wrought iron<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> as a structural material<span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/div&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="161"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>The science of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classical_mechanics" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Classical_mechanics</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Classical mechanics</span>"&gt;</span>classical mechanics<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, sometimes called Newtonian mechanics, formed the scientific basis of much of modern engineering.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Robinson-Musnon_50-2</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-Robinson-Musnon-50" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-Robinson-Musnon-50</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;50&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> With the rise of engineering as a <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Profession" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Profession</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Profession</span>"&gt;</span>profession<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> in the 18th century, the term became more narrowly applied to fields in which mathematics and science were applied to these ends. Similarly, in addition to military and civil engineering, the fields then known as the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanic_arts" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Mechanic_arts</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Mechanic arts</span>"&gt;</span>mechanic arts<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> became incorporated into engineering.</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="162"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>Canal building was an important engineering work during the early phases of the Industrial Revolution.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-51</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-51" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-51</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;51&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="163"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Smeaton" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/John_Smeaton</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">John Smeaton</span>"&gt;</span>John Smeaton<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> was the first self-proclaimed civil engineer and is often regarded as the "father" of civil engineering. He was an English civil engineer responsible for the design of bridges, canals, harbors, and lighthouses. He was also a capable <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanical_engineer" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Mechanical_engineer</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">mw-redirect</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Mechanical engineer</span>"&gt;</span>mechanical engineer<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and an eminent <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physicist" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Physicist</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Physicist</span>"&gt;</span>physicist<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>. Using a model water wheel, Smeaton conducted experiments for seven years, determining ways to increase efficiency.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-University_Of_Chicago_Press_52-0</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-University_Of_Chicago_Press-52" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-University_Of_Chicago_Press-52</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;52&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference nowrap</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;span <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Page / location: 127</span>"&gt;</span>&amp;#58;&amp;#8202;127&amp;#8202;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/span&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span>   Smeaton introduced iron axles and gears to water wheels.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-Robinson-Musnon_50-3</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-Robinson-Musnon-50" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-Robinson-Musnon-50</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;50&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference nowrap</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;span <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Page / location: 69</span>"&gt;</span>&amp;#58;&amp;#8202;69&amp;#8202;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/span&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> Smeaton also made mechanical improvements to the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newcomen_atmospheric_engine" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Newcomen_atmospheric_engine</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Newcomen atmospheric engine</span>"&gt;</span>Newcomen steam engine<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>. Smeaton designed the third <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eddystone_Lighthouse" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Eddystone_Lighthouse</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Eddystone Lighthouse</span>"&gt;</span>Eddystone Lighthouse<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> (1755–59) where he pioneered the use of '<span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydraulic_lime" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Hydraulic_lime</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Hydraulic lime</span>"&gt;</span>hydraulic lime<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>' (a form of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mortar_(masonry)" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Mortar_(masonry)</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Mortar (masonry)</span>"&gt;</span>mortar<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> which will set under water) and developed a technique involving dovetailed blocks of granite in the building of the lighthouse. He is important in the history, rediscovery of, and development of modern <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cement" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Cement</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Cement</span>"&gt;</span>cement<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, because he identified the compositional requirements needed to obtain "hydraulicity" in lime; work which led ultimately to the invention of <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portland_cement" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Portland_cement</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Portland cement</span>"&gt;</span>Portland cement<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.</td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="164"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;p&gt;</span>Applied science lead to the development of the steam engine.  The sequence of events began with the invention of the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barometer" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Barometer</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Barometer</span>"&gt;</span>barometer<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> and the measurement of atmospheric pressure by <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evangelista_Torricelli" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Evangelista_Torricelli</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Evangelista Torricelli</span>"&gt;</span>Evangelista Torricelli<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> in 1643, demonstration of the force of atmospheric pressure by <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_von_Guericke" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Otto_von_Guericke</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Otto von Guericke</span>"&gt;</span>Otto von Guericke<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> using the <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magdeburg_hemispheres" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Magdeburg_hemispheres</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Magdeburg hemispheres</span>"&gt;</span>Magdeburg hemispheres<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> in 1656, laboratory experiments by <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denis_Papin" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Denis_Papin</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Denis Papin</span>"&gt;</span>Denis Papin<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, who built experimental model steam engines and demonstrated the use of a piston, which he published in 1707.  <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Somerset,_2nd_Marquess_of_Worcester" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Edward_Somerset,_2nd_Marquess_of_Worcester</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Edward Somerset, 2nd Marquess of Worcester</span>"&gt;</span>Edward Somerset, 2nd Marquess of Worcester<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> published a book of 100 inventions containing a method for raising waters similar to a <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coffee_percolator" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Coffee_percolator</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Coffee percolator</span>"&gt;</span>coffee percolator<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>.  <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Morland" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Samuel_Morland</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Samuel Morland</span>"&gt;</span>Samuel Morland<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, a mathematician and inventor who worked on pumps, left notes at the Vauxhall Ordinance Office on a steam pump design that <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Savery" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Thomas_Savery</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Thomas Savery</span>"&gt;</span>Thomas Savery<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span> read. In 1698 Savery built a steam pump called "The Miner's Friend." It employed both vacuum and pressure.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-53</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-53" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-53</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;53&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span> Iron merchant <span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Newcomen" rel="noreferrer noopener">/wiki/Thomas_Newcomen</a>" <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Thomas Newcomen</span>"&gt;</span>Thomas Newcomen<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span>, who built the first commercial piston steam engine in 1712, was not known to have any scientific training.<span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">id</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">cite_ref-University_Of_Chicago_Press_52-1</span>" <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;a <span class="html-attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="html-attribute-value html-external-link" target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Engineering#cite_note-University_Of_Chicago_Press-52" rel="noreferrer noopener">#cite_note-University_Of_Chicago_Press-52</a>"&gt;</span>&amp;#91;52&amp;#93;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/a&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;sup <span class="html-attribute-name">class</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">reference nowrap</span>"&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;span <span class="html-attribute-name">title</span>="<span class="html-attribute-value">Page / location: 32</span>"&gt;</span>&amp;#58;&amp;#8202;32&amp;#8202;<span class="html-tag">&lt;/span&gt;</span><span class="html-tag">&lt;/sup&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="165"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;/p&gt;</span></td></tr><tr><td class="line-number" value="166"></td><td class="line-content"><span class="html-tag">&lt;div <span
